pullRequest.body:
Feat: Add `Similiarty` in `Topology.MetricSpace.Similarity`

This is a port of a mathlib branch:

https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib/pull/18214

See #7478 for more context.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: Is it the same as https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/MetricSpace/Dilation.html#Dilation ?

### PR summary [b9bd53fd10](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/7479/commits/b9bd53fd104dde82ea86a3edf9cd2a359d7f83d5)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Topology.MetricSpace.Similarity` (new file)|893|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Congruent.similar`
`+ Similar`
`+ _root_.similar_comm`
`+ exists_dist_eq`
`+ exists_edist_eq`
`+ exists_nndist_eq`
`+ exists_pairwise_dist_eq`
`+ exists_pairwise_edist_eq`
`+ exists_pairwise_nndist_eq`
`+ index_equiv`
`+ index_map`
`+ of_exists_dist_eq`
`+ of_exists_edist_eq`
`+ of_exists_nndist_eq`
`+ of_exists_pairwise_dist_eq`
`+ of_exists_pairwise_edist_eq`
`+ of_exists_pairwise_nndist_eq`
`+ of_pairwise_exists_edist_eq`
`+ refl`
`+ similar_iff_exists_dist_eq`
`+ similar_iff_exists_edist_eq`
`+ similar_iff_exists_nndist_eq`
`+ similar_iff_exists_pairwise_dist_eq`
`+ similar_iff_exists_pairwise_edist_eq`
`+ similar_iff_exists_pairwise_nndist_eq`
`+ symm`
`+ trans`
`++++++++++++ _`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This one is a predicate on two indexed families of points, `Dilation` is a map on PseudoEMetricSpaces such that this predicate holds for all families of points. The converse - that this predicate on two indexed families can be extended to a `Dilation` from the first space to the second that maps the first indexed family to the second - is a theorem that holds under appropriate conditions in Euclidean spaces (as discussed on Zulip, existing lemmas about distances and inner products for affine combinations should provide most of what's needed to prove that theorem), but not in more general metric space context.

On the whole I think we should probably get #7478 sorted out before this one, though I don't think there's any actual dependency between them.

Note that the mathlib3 PRs also include various Euclidean results about congruence and similarity for angles and triangles, that haven't been ported to Lean 4 as far as I know (but of course the basic metric space content should be dealt with first).
I don't have the time right now (maybe in the future??) to work on these PRs (this one and #7478).  If the changes they introduce are needed, feel free to take them over.

@JovanGerb you are down as an author of the file being PRed! Perhaps because you wrote the original Lean 3 code? Do you have any comments on this PR? It looks fine to me, I am sorely tempted to bors d+ it if you approve.

I would prefer to call this `Similar`, analogous to `Congruent` (because we say two triangles are congruent/similar)

(In my original PR, I called them `congruence` and `similarity`, but `congruence` is now called `Congruent`)

Since `Similar` does essentially the same as `Congruent`, I'd like the two files the look the same as much as possible. Two differences are:
- For `Congruent`, the different `dist_eq` results are separated by `PseudoMetricSpace` and `PseudoEMetricSpace`, whereas in `Similar`, they are put together. I prefer having them together.
- For `Congruent`, the `dist_eq` results have a duplicate version using `Pairwise`. `Similar` doesn't have this. I'd think we either want this in both, or in neither.
I've now split the results into sections by type class requirements (so avoiding such requirements on individual lemmas, putting them all in `variable` instead), as in the other file.
The name `Similar` is now used in place of `Similarity`.
I've now aligned the `Pairwise` lemmas with those for `Congruent`, I hope.

I think all the requested changes are now made (or explicitly not made, in the cases of changes suggested to the other file - for the splitting by sections, I prefer the approach split by type class assumptions anyway).

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion similarity v v ```

```suggestion
This file defines `Similarity`, i.e., the equivalence between indexed sets of points in a metric space
```

```suggestion
where all corresponding pairwise distances have the same ratio. The motivating example is
```

```suggestion
Let `P` and `P` be metric spaces, let `` be an index set, and let `v :   P` and `v :   P` be indexed families of points.

```

I think "scales" is a better word than "preserves".

Can you also make these comments align with how they are for `Congruent`? So for this one:
/-- A similarity scales extended distance. Forward direction of `similarity_iff_exists_edist_eq` -/
Now says "scales". And doc strings now better aligned, I hope.
Should this be named `similar_comm`? And should `congruence_comm` be renamed to `congruent_comm`?
Renamed here. Renaming in the other file seems out of scope for this PR.

```suggestion
@[refl] protected lemma refl (v :   P) : v  v :=
```
Can these get the same doc-strings as in `Congruent`?
Added those doc strings.

```suggestion
/-- A similarity holds if and only if all extended distances are proportional. -/
```
Similarly for a couple other docstrings
There are a few more copies of this mistake
All fixed.

Which is more correct, "Similarity holds iff" or "A similarity holds iff"? I'd go for
- Similarity holds if and only if ..
- Similarity follows from ..
- A similarity scales ..
I've made those further suggested changes.

pullRequest.title: feat(Topology/MetricSpace/Similarity): define Similar
